travelArticleText.value:
Known mainly for Tokyo, with its futuristic neon skyscrapers, and Kyoto, filled with temples and gardens, Japan has a lot more to offer. It consists of over 6,800 islands, and each island is a stunning blend of wild nature and local culture. We picked 3 islands that are must-see on your next trip to Japan.

Sado

Location

Sado Island is located near the coast of Niigata Prefecture and is one of the largest islands in Japan.

Best time to visit

Plan your visit to the island in August to attend the Earth Celebration.

What to see

  1. Earth Celebration - Sado's biggest attraction, an annual music festival hosted by Sado's own, world-renowned Kodo taiko (Japanese drums) group.
  2. Sado Kinzan was the most profitable mine in the country, extracting about 400 kg of gold each year. Today the Sado Kinzan Gold Mine, with a museum inside, is open to the public.
  3. The Osado Skyline - a picturesque route in the Osado Mountains, going from the center of the island to the Sado Gold Mine, that offers scenic views of the island.

Random Fact

Due to its isolated and distant location, Sado served as a place for political exiles, like former Emperor Juntoku, the Buddhist monk Nichiren, and the founder of Noh theater, Zeami Motokiyo.

 

Iriomote

Location

Iriomote Island is one of the remote Yaeyama Islands in southwestern Japan. There are practically no buildings on the island, nearly 90% of Iriomote is covered by dense jungles and forests.

Best time to visit

Mid-June to mid-July in order to see Sagari-bana, one of the most beautiful Okinawan flowers.

What to do

Iriomote Island is best for exploring its land, hiking the trails to pristine waterfalls, kayaking through the forests, or navigating along one of the island's rivers that flows through the jungle.

You can also visit tiny Yubu Island that is separated from the east coast of Iriomote Island by a shallow, sandy strait. You can ride across to the island in a cart pulled by a buffalo, while the driver plays the sanshin (an Okinawan stringed instrument) and entertains you with traditional songs.

Random Fact

Iriomote is the only habitat of the Iriomote cat, rare species of leopard that is critically endangered.

 

Ishikagi

Location

Ishigaki Island is the main island of the Yaeyama Islands and the region's transportation hub.

The City of Ishigaki is the only downtown of the Yaeyama Islands with the region's main airport, harbor station, and a lot of authentic cafes, bars, and boutiques.

Best time to visit

From April till June: it is warm enough, and heavy rain season is not started.

What to do

Ishigaki Island has sandy beaches of incredible beauty that offer top-notch snorkeling and diving experience. Countless dive shops offer diving tours to coral reefs near the island.

Ishigaki's rivers are perfect for kayaking, and various trails throughout the island's hilly terrain are good for hiking.

Random Fact

Ishigaki means “stone wall”. The island was named after the stone walls that were built along the streets of Ishigaki and still can be found in the city.
